item.title: [Intro to Computational Thinking] R Basics 2
item.description: üìù Lesson Preview Functions Control Flow if statements for loops apply() Parallel computation Functions If objects are the nouns of the R language, functions are the verbs. They do things to objects. Let‚Äôs use the mean function as an example. This function takes the mean of a numeric vector object. Remember our numeric_vector object from Lesson 1: numeric_vector <- c(2.

item.title: [Intro to Computational Thinking] Introduction to Computational Thinking via Simulation with R
item.description: ‚ÄúWhat I cannot create, I do not understand‚Äù ‚Äì Richard Feynman ‚ÄúIt is immoral to collect data before simulating the hypothesized data generating process.‚Äù ‚Äì Andrew Gelman (what I remember of a comment to the Stanford Causal Inference Seminar in 2020). üìù Lesson Preview Why simulate? Simple simulation workflow Documenting Functions in RMonte Carlo with apply and parallelization
